thread.title: Star Wars 7 Trailer Releasing Today: Tickets Available For Sale
thread.title_full: Star Wars 7 Trailer Releasing Today: Tickets Available For Sale

title: Star Wars 7 Trailer Releasing Today: Tickets Available For Sale
text:
Star Wars 7 Trailer Releasing Today: Tickets Available For Sale Written by: Chaitra Published: Monday, October 19, 2015, 11:38 [IST] 
The Star Wars: The Force Awakens poster was released on Oct 18 morning. The trailer will be out today (Oct 19) by 8:30 PM and the tickets will go on sale online following the release of the trailer. 
The much awaited 7th episode of the Star Wars, The Force Awakens is scheduled to be released in December and the tickets are going to be available to purchase, 2 months prior to the release. 
The official movie poster for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" was posted on 18th October morning on StarWars.com by Disney and Lucasfilm. 
The teaser poster looks very similar to the original Star wars movies poster created by the artist Drew Struzan with a lot of characters, including Han Solo and Princess Leia, but notably not Luke Skywalker. 
While the poster alone is gaining so much attention, the fans are more excited for the trailer that's going to be out in the evening of 19th October. 
The movies is scheduled to be released on the 18th of December. Reports say, The Force Awakens is going to be 142 minutes long and that would make it the third longest Star Wars movie after the Attack of the Clones and The Phantom Menace. 
Star Wars: The Force Awakens is directed by J. J. Abrams. He is also known for the Lost series, Mission Impossible movies and the new Star Trek movies. 
While talking about the characters in the 7th Episode of the Star Wars, Abram said, "As you see in the best of storytelling, and no doubt the best of Star Wars, these are tales in which an every person has to step up." 
"And I think that what makes Ren so unique is that he isn't as fully formed as when we meet a character such as Darth Vader," He further added. "And I think that there are two sides to the Force. Both sides, arguably, would see themselves as the hero of their story, and I think that applies here." 
In a few hours' time the official trailer of Star Wars: The Force Awakens will be out and so will be sale of tickets to the movie. The space adventure movie fans couldn't wait any longer as they've been solving the puzzle with bits and pieces from the teaser posters. 
The trailer is going to give the fans all the information they've been awaiting to know about another great Star Wars series.
